title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g′(x) = f(x) in (a), (b), (c), or (d)

1 point is earned for answer with justification

The function g has neither a relative minimum nor a relative maximum at x = 10 since g′(x) = f(x) and f(x) ≤ 0 for 8 ≤ x ≤ 12.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g′(x) = f(x) in (a), (b), (c), or (d)

1 point is earned for answer with justification

The graph of g has a point of inflection at x = 4 since g′(x) = f(x) is increasing for 2 ≤ x ≤ 4 and decreasing for 4 ≤ x ≤ 8.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g′(x) = f(x) in (a), (b), (c), or (d)

1 point is earned for considering x = -2 and x = 6 as candidates

g′(x) = f(x) changes sign only at x = −2 and x = 6

1 point is earned for considering x = -4 and x = 12

2 points are earned for answers with justification

On the interval −4 ≤ x ≤ 12, the absolute minimum value is g(−2) = -8 and the absolute maximum value is g(6) = 8.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g′(x) = f(x) in (a), (b), (c), or (d)

2 point are earned for intervals

g(x) ≤ 0 for −4 ≤ x ≤ 2 and 10 ≤ x ≤ 12.
